printLineNumbers.haxe_doc: When the printing line changes print the line number before the message.

printPosition.haxe_doc: When the printing position changes (position is className.methodName), print the new position before the message.

class.haxe_doc: A base ConsolePrinter implementation for functionality shared by FlashConsolePrinter, HTMLConsolePrinter and CommandLineConsolePrinter.

A ConsolePrinter is responsible for printing the output of the Console. Messages can be printed at different LogLevels and at different indentations. Implementations can also define activate/deactivate behavior when they are set/unset as the current console printer using Console.setPrinter()

CONSOLE_STYLES.haxe_doc: The styles added to the document for the console printer.

printLine.haxe_doc:
Prints a single line of coloured output to the log panel. Each line is linked to open the position where it was printed using the sublime URL scheme (mac only).
https://github.com/hiddenbek/subl-handler

updateScroll.haxe_doc: When output scrolls, evaluate whether output is scrolled to the bottom.

atBottom.haxe_doc: Is the log output currently scrolled to the bottom. When true new logs will cause the log output window to scroll to display new log entries.

projectHome.haxe_doc: The projects home directory, determined at compilation time by a macro. Used to determine absolute URLs to log positions, so that clicking on a log can open the correct file (and line, if supported) in a users editor.

element.haxe_doc: The HTML element to print to, created when the printer is constructed and attached to document.body.

class.haxe_doc: A Printer that prints formatted logs to an HTML element.

printers.haxe_doc: The ConsolePrinters to print output to.

groupDepth.haxe_doc: The current group depth, incremented when group(name) is called, and decremented when groupEnd() is called.

counts.haxe_doc: A hash of counters by a unique posInfo identifier.

previousTrace.haxe_doc: The previous value of haxe.Log.trace if redirectTraces has been called, or null if it has not.

start.haxe_doc:
Starts the console, redirecting haxe.Log.trace and adding a default printer if WebKit is not available.
The trace method accepts a variable number of arguments which are passed to the console. If the first argument is a string that matches a log level (log, info, warn...) then the trace is logged at that level.

stop.haxe_doc: Restores the console to an inactive state.

haxeTrace.haxe_doc: The method called by Haxe trace. Checks if the first parameter matches a log level, and forwards the log to the appropriate handler.

print.haxe_doc: Print a message to each of the printers.

warn.haxe_doc: Logs a "warning" icon followed by a color-coded message.

error.haxe_doc: Logs an "error" icon followed by a color-coded message.

trace.haxe_doc: Logs a stack trace at the moment the function is called. The stack trace lists the functions on the call stack (functions that have been called and have not yet finished executing and returned) and the values of any arguments passed to those functions.

assert.haxe_doc: If expression evaluates to false, logs the message.

count.haxe_doc: Logs the number of times this line of code has executed, and an optional title.

group.haxe_doc: Logs the message object and begins an indented block for further log entries.

groupEnd.haxe_doc: Ends an indented block of log entries.

time.haxe_doc: Starts a timer and gives it a name.

timeEnd.haxe_doc: Logs the time since Console.time(name) was called, and restarts the timer.

markTimeline.haxe_doc: Adds a label to the timeline view marking when the point when the method was called.

profile.haxe_doc: Begins profiling JavaScriptâ€”tracking the number of times each function is called, the time spent in that function, and the time spent in nested groups of functions. If a title is provided, the profile is named.

profileEnd.haxe_doc: Ends one or more JavaScript profiles. If a title is provided and a running profile has a matching title, only the current run of that profile is ended. Otherwise, the current run of all profiles is ended.

enterDebugger.haxe_doc: Inserts a breakpoint at the calling position.

isWebKit.haxe_doc: Is the WebKit console API available?

detectWebKit.haxe_doc: Detects if the WebKit console API is available, either natively in JavaScript or via ExternalConnection in Flash.

callWebKit.haxe_doc: Calls a method on the WebKit console API, either directly in JS or via ExternalInterface in Flash running in a WebKit browser.

toWebKitValues.haxe_doc: Convert parameters for console methods into 'native' objects that will print.

toWebKitValue.haxe_doc: Converts a value into the anything that will print nicely in the console.

class.haxe_doc:
This console implementation assumes the availability of the WebKit console. We inline calls to the native API rather than simply creating an extern so we can add additional console methods (such as enterDebugger). This also means we can convert some Haxe structures (XML for example) into something more readable in the console.
In flash, we call the WebKit console API through ExternalInterface.
A macro helpers for the console package.

warn.haxe_doc: Logs indicating unexpected but not fatal program behavior.

info.haxe_doc: Logs important for following the current state of a program.

debug.haxe_doc: Logs important for debugging problems with a program.

enum.haxe_doc: Log levels are a way for developers to group and filter log messages depending on the kind of information being logged.
An enum defining possible colors for console output.

class.haxe_doc: A utility class for formatting stack traces as strings.
A utility class for formatting stack items as strings.
